alert.note: Alert for Eastern Culberson County; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 5:01PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Culberson County through 530 PM CDT... At 500 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Pine Springs, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pine Springs and Guadalupe Mountains National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Culberson County; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
